lines.line: What am I to do?
What's wrong?
Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear, I'm in a terrible terrible mess! It's the Duke's birthday today, and I should be making him a lovely big birthday cake.
I've forgotten to buy the ingredients. I'll never get them in time now. He'll sack me! What will I do? I have four children and a goat to look after. Would you help me? Please?
Yes, I'll help you.
Oh thank you, thank you. I need milk, an egg and flour. I'd be very grateful if you can get them for me.
I have all of those ingredients on me already!
That's an odd coincidence... Were you planning on making a cake too?
Not exactly. I just had an odd feeling you might be needing these ingredients. If I see a cook, I presume there's food of some kind! Lucky guess I suppose.
Well thank you! Hand them over, please.
You've brought me everything I need! I am saved! Thank you!
So do I get to go to the Duke's Party?
I'm afraid not, only the big cheeses get to dine with the Duke.
Well, maybe one day I'll be important enough to sit on the Duke's table.
Maybe, but I won't be holding my breath.
So where do I find these ingredients then?
There is a Mill fairly close, go North and then West. Mill Lane Mill is just off the road to Draynor. I usually get my flour from there.
Talk to Millie, she'll help, she's a lovely girl and a fine Miller. Make sure you take a pot with you for the flour though, you've got one on you already.
Talk to Millie, she'll help, she's a lovely girl and a fine Miller. Make sure you take a pot with you for the flour though, there should be one on the table in here.
There is a cattle field on the other side of the river, just across the road from the Groats' Farm.
Talk to Gillie Groats, she looks after the Dairy cows - she'll tell you everything you need to know about milking cows!
You'll need an empty bucket for the milk itself. I do see you've got a bucket with you already luckily!
You'll need an empty bucket for the milk itself. The general store just north of the castle will sell you one for a couple of coins.
I normally get my eggs from the Groats' farm, on the other side of the river.
But any chicken should lay eggs.
I've got all the information I need. Thanks.
Actually, I know where to find this stuff.
No, I don't feel like it. Maybe later.
Fine. I always knew you Adventurer types were callous beasts. Go on your merry way!
You're a cook, why don't you bake me a cake?
*sniff* Don't talk to me about cakes...
You don't look very happy.
No, I'm not. The world is caving in around me - I am overcome by dark feelings of impending doom.
I'd take the rest of the day off if I were you.
No, that's the worst thing I could do. I'd get in terrible trouble.
Well maybe you need to take a holiday...
That would be nice, but the Duke doesn't allow holidays for core staff.
Hmm, why not run away to the sea and start a new life as a Pirate?
My wife gets sea sick, and I have an irrational fear of eyepatches. I don't see it working myself.
I'm afraid I've run out of ideas.
I know I'm doomed.
Nice hat!
Err thank you. It's a pretty ordinary cooks hat really.
Still, suits you. The trousers are pretty special too.
Its all standard cook's issue uniform...
The whole hat, apron, stripey trousers ensemble - it works. It make you looks like a real cook.
I am a real cook! I haven't got time to be chatting about Culinary Fashion. I am in desperate need of help!
How are you getting on with finding the ingredients?
I haven't got any of them yet, I'm still looking.
Please get the ingredients quickly - I'm running out of time! The Duke will throw me into the streets!
Here's a bucket of milk.
Here's a pot of flour.
Here's a fresh egg.
Thanks for the ingredients you have got so far. Please get the rest quickly - I'm running out of time! The Duke will throw me into the streets!

characters.name: Cook
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, anxious and flustered tone, a well-meaning but forgetful castle cook who is easily overwhelmed and prone to panic under pressure.
